parameter.name: ctl_bw
parameter.long_desc: Speed controller bandwidth, in Hz. Higher values result in faster speed and current rise times, but may result in overshoot and higher current consumption. For fixed-wing aircraft, this value should be less than 50 Hz; for multirotors, values up to 100 Hz may provide improvements in responsiveness.

parameter.name: ctl_dir
parameter.long_desc: Motor spin direction as detected during initial enumeration. Use 0 or 1 to reverse direction.

parameter.name: ctl_gain
parameter.long_desc: Speed (RPM) controller gain. Determines controller aggressiveness; units are amp-seconds per radian. Systems with higher rotational inertia (large props) will need gain increased; systems with low rotational inertia (small props) may need gain decreased. Higher values result in faster response, but may result in oscillation and excessive overshoot. Lower values result in a slower, smoother response.

parameter.name: ctl_hz_idle
parameter.long_desc: Idle speed (e Hz)

parameter.name: ctl_start_rate
parameter.long_desc: Spin-up rate (e Hz/s)

parameter.name: esc_index
parameter.short_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.
parameter.long_desc: Index of this ESC in throttle command messages.

parameter.name: id_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status ID

parameter.name: int_ext_status
parameter.long_desc: Extended status interval (µs)

parameter.name: int_status
parameter.long_desc: ESC status interval (µs)

parameter.name: mot_i_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor current limit in amps. This determines the maximum current controller setpoint, as well as the maximum allowable current setpoint slew rate. This value should generally be set to the continuous current rating listed in the motor’s specification sheet, or set equal to the motor’s specified continuous power divided by the motor voltage limit.

parameter.name: mot_kv
parameter.short_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt
parameter.long_desc: Motor Kv in RPM per volt. This can be taken from the motor’s specification sheet; accuracy will help control performance but some deviation from the specified value is acceptable.

parameter.name: mot_ls
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries.
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor inductance in henries. This is measured on start-up.

parameter.name: mot_num_poles
parameter.long_desc: Number of motor poles. Used to convert mechanical speeds to electrical speeds. This number should be taken from the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_rs
parameter.short_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms
parameter.long_desc: READ ONLY: Motor resistance in ohms. This is measured on start-up. When tuning a new motor, check that this value is approximately equal to the value shown in the motor’s specification sheet.

parameter.name: mot_v_accel
parameter.long_desc: Acceleration limit (V)

parameter.name: mot_v_max
parameter.long_desc: Motor voltage limit in volts. The current controller’s commanded voltage will never exceed this value. Note that this may safely be above the nominal voltage of the motor; to determine the actual motor voltage limit, divide the motor’s rated power by the motor current limit.

parameter.name: gnss.dyn_model
parameter.long_desc: Dynamic model used in the GNSS positioning engine. 0 – Automotive, 1 – Sea, 2 – Airborne.

parameter.name: gnss.old_fix_msg
parameter.long_desc: Broadcast the old (deprecated) GNSS fix message uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix alongside the new alternative uavcan.equipment.gnss.Fix2. It is recommended to disable this feature to reduce the CAN bus traffic.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_dimens
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the dimensionality of the GNSS solution is less than this value. 3 for the full (3D) solution, 2 for planar (2D) solution, 1 for time-only solution, 0 disables the feature.

parameter.name: gnss.warn_sats
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: uavcan.pubp-pres
parameter.long_desc: Set the device health to Warning if the number of satellites used in the GNSS solution is below this threshold. Zero disables the feature

parameter.name: ASPD_BETA_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Gate size for sideslip angle fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: ASPD_BETA_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator sideslip measurement noise
parameter.long_desc: Sideslip measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ASPD_DO_CHECKS
parameter.long_desc: Controls which checks are run to check airspeed data for validity. Only applied if ASPD_PRIMARY > 0. Note that the data missing check is enabled if any of the options is set.

bitmask.bit: Only data missing check (triggers if more than 1s no data)
Data stuck (triggers if data is exactly constant for 2s)
Load factor check (triggers if measurement is below stall speed)

parameter.name: ASPD_FALLBACK_GW
parameter.short_desc: Enable fallback to sensor-less airspeed estimation
parameter.long_desc: If set to true and airspeed checks are enabled, it will use a sensor-less airspeed estimation based on groundspeed minus windspeed if no other airspeed sensor available to fall back to.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_INNOV
parameter.long_desc: This specifies the minimum airspeed innovation required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller values make it more sensitive. Large innovations indicate an inconsistency between predicted (groundspeed - windspeeed) and measured airspeed. The time required to detect a fault when the threshold is exceeded depends on the size of the exceedance and is controlled by the ASPD_FS_INTEG parameter.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_INTEG
parameter.long_desc: This sets the time integral of airspeed innovation exceedance above ASPD_FS_INNOV required to trigger a failsafe. Larger values make the check less sensitive, smaller positive values make it more sensitive.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_T_START
parameter.long_desc: Delay before switching back to using airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is good. Set to a negative value to disable the re-enabling in flight.

parameter.name: ASPD_FS_T_STOP
parameter.long_desc: Delay before stopping use of airspeed sensor if checks indicate sensor is bad.

parameter.name: ASPD_PRIMARY
parameter.short_desc: Index or primary airspeed measurement source

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_1
parameter.long_desc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the first airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_2
parameter.long_desc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the second airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_3
parameter.long_desc: This is the scale IAS --> CAS of the third airspeed sensor instance

parameter.name: ASPD_SCALE_APPLY
parameter.short_desc: Controls when to apply the new estimated airspeed scale(s)

values.value: Do not automatically apply the estimated scale
Apply the estimated scale after disarm
Apply the estimated scale in air

parameter.name: ASPD_SC_P_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator true airspeed scale process noise
parameter.long_desc: Airspeed scale process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ASPD_TAS_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Gate size for true airspeed fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: ASPD_TAS_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator true airspeed measurement noise
parameter.long_desc: True airspeed measurement noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: ASPD_W_P_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed Selector: Wind estimator wind process noise
parameter.long_desc: Wind process noise of the internal wind estimator(s) of the airspeed selector.

parameter.name: AVC_X_D
parameter.short_desc: Body X axis angular velocity D gain
parameter.long_desc: Body X axis angular velocity differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: AVC_X_FF
parameter.short_desc: Body X axis angular velocity feedforward gain
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: AVC_X_I
parameter.short_desc: Body X axis angular velocity I gain
parameter.long_desc: Body X axis angular velocity integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: AVC_X_I_LIM
parameter.short_desc: Body X axis angular velocity integrator limit
parameter.long_desc: Body X axis angular velocity integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large roll moment trim changes.

parameter.name: AVC_X_K
parameter.short_desc: Body X axis angular velocity controller gain
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = AVC_X_K * (AVC_X_P * error + AVC_X_I * error_integral + AVC_X_D * error_derivative) Set AVC_X_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set AVC_X_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: AVC_X_P
parameter.short_desc: Body X axis angular velocity P gain
parameter.long_desc: Body X axis angular velocity proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: AVC_Y_D
parameter.short_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity D gain
parameter.long_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: AVC_Y_FF
parameter.short_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity feedforward
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: AVC_Y_I
parameter.short_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity I gain
parameter.long_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: AVC_Y_I_LIM
parameter.short_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity integrator limit
parameter.long_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large pitch moment trim changes.

parameter.name: AVC_Y_K
parameter.short_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity controller gain
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = AVC_Y_K * (AVC_Y_P * error + AVC_Y_I * error_integral + AVC_Y_D * error_derivative) Set AVC_Y_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set AVC_Y_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: AVC_Y_P
parameter.short_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity P gain
parameter.long_desc: Body Y axis angular velocity proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: AVC_Z_D
parameter.short_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity D gain
parameter.long_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity differential gain. Small values help reduce fast oscillations. If value is too big oscillations will appear again.

parameter.name: AVC_Z_FF
parameter.short_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity feedforward
parameter.long_desc: Improves tracking performance.

parameter.name: AVC_Z_I
parameter.short_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity I gain
parameter.long_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity integral gain. Can be set to compensate static thrust difference or gravity center offset.

parameter.name: AVC_Z_I_LIM
parameter.short_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity integrator limit
parameter.long_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity integrator limit. Can be set to increase the amount of integrator available to counteract disturbances or reduced to improve settling time after large yaw moment trim changes.

parameter.name: AVC_Z_K
parameter.short_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity controller gain
parameter.long_desc: Global gain of the controller. This gain scales the P, I and D terms of the controller: output = AVC_Z_K * (AVC_Z_P * error + AVC_Z_I * error_integral + AVC_Z_D * error_derivative) Set AVC_Z_P=1 to implement a PID in the ideal form. Set AVC_Z_K=1 to implement a PID in the parallel form.

parameter.name: AVC_Z_P
parameter.short_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity P gain
parameter.long_desc: Body Z axis angular velocity proportional gain, i.e. control output for angular speed error 1 rad/s.

parameter.name: ATT_ACC_COMP
parameter.short_desc: Acceleration compensation based on GPS velocity

parameter.name: ATT_EXT_HDG_M
parameter.short_desc: External heading usage mode (from Motion capture/Vision)
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to use heading estimate from vision. Set to 2 to use heading from motion capture.

parameter.name: ATT_MAG_DECL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is not used in normal operation, as the declination is looked up based on the GPS coordinates of the vehicle.

parameter.name: ATT_W_MAG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to avoid using the magnetometer.

parameter.name: FW_AT_APPLY
parameter.short_desc: Controls when to apply the new gains
parameter.long_desc: After the auto-tuning sequence is completed, a new set of gains is available and can be applied immediately or after landing.

values.value: Do not apply the new gains (logging only)
Apply the new gains after disarm
Apply the new gains in air

parameter.name: FW_AT_AXES
parameter.long_desc: Defines which axes will be tuned during the auto-tuning sequence Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Roll 1 : Pitch 2 : Yaw

parameter.name: FW_AT_START
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: this will inject steps to the rate controller and can be dangerous. Only activate if you know what you are doing, and in a safe environment. Any motion of the remote stick will abord the signal injection and reset this parameter Best is to perform the identification in position or hold mode. Increase the amplitude of the injected signal using FW_AT_SYSID_AMP for more signal/noise ratio

parameter.name: FW_AT_SYSID_AMP
parameter.long_desc: This parameter scales the signal sent to the rate controller during system identification.

parameter.name: MC_AT_APPLY
parameter.short_desc: Controls when to apply the new gains
parameter.long_desc: After the auto-tuning sequence is completed, a new set of gains is available and can be applied immediately or after landing. WARNING Applying the gains in air is dangerous as there is no guarantee that those new gains will be able to stabilize the drone properly.

values.value: Do not apply the new gains (logging only)
Apply the new gains after disarm
WARNING Apply the new gains in air

parameter.name: MC_AT_RISE_TIME
parameter.short_desc: Desired angular rate closed-loop rise time

parameter.name: MC_AT_START
parameter.long_desc: WARNING: this will inject steps to the rate controller and can be dangerous. Only activate if you know what you are doing, and in a safe environment. Any motion of the remote stick will abord the signal injection and reset this parameter Best is to perform the identification in position or hold mode. Increase the amplitude of the injected signal using MC_AT_SYSID_AMP for more signal/noise ratio

parameter.name: BAT_ADC_CHANNEL
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_I_CHANNEL

parameter.name: BAT_CRIT_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as critically low. This has to be lower than the low threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger RTL.

parameter.name: BAT_EMERGEN_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as dangerously low. This has to be lower than the critical threshold. This threshold commonly will trigger landing.

parameter.name: BAT_LOW_THR
parameter.long_desc: Sets the threshold when the battery will be reported as low. This has to be higher than the critical threshold.

parameter.name: BAT_N_CELLS
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_N_CELLS instead

parameter.name: BAT_V_CHARGED
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_CHARGED instead

parameter.name: BAT_V_EMPTY
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_EMPTY instead

parameter.name: BAT_V_LOAD_DROP
parameter.short_desc: This parameter is deprecated. Please use BAT1_V_LOAD_DROP instead

parameter.name: BAT_V_OFFS_CURR
parameter.short_desc: Offset in volt as seen by the ADC input of the current sensor
parameter.long_desc: This offset will be subtracted before calculating the battery current based on the voltage.

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_DELAY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the delay between image integration start and strobe firing

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_FBACK
parameter.long_desc: Enables camera capture feedback

parameter.name: CAM_CAP_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Change time measurement

values.value: Get timestamp of mid exposure (active high)
Get timestamp of mid exposure (active low)

parameter.name: TRIG_ACT_TIME
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time the trigger needs to pulled high or low.

parameter.name: TRIG_DISTANCE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the distance at which to trigger the camera.

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERFACE
parameter.long_desc: Selects the trigger interface

parameter.name: TRIG_INTERVAL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the time between two consecutive trigger events

parameter.name: TRIG_MIN_INTERVA
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the minimum time between two consecutive trigger events the specific camera setup is supporting.

parameter.name: TRIG_PINS
parameter.long_desc: Selects which FMU pin is used (range: AUX1-AUX8 on Pixhawk controllers with an I/O board, MAIN1-MAIN8 on controllers without an I/O board). The PWM interface takes two pins per camera, while relay triggers on every pin individually. Example: Value 56 would trigger on pins 5 and 6. For GPIO mode Pin 6 will be triggered followed by 5. With a value of 65 pin 5 will be triggered followed by 6. Pins may be non contiguous. I.E. 16 or 61. In GPIO mode the delay pin to pin is < .2 uS.

parameter.name: TRIG_PINS_EX
parameter.long_desc: This Bit mask selects which FMU pin is used (range: AUX9-AUX32) If the value is not 0 it takes precedence over TRIG_PINS. If bits above 8 are set that value is used as the selector for trigger pins. greater then 8. 0x00000300 Would be Pins 9,10. If the value is

parameter.name: TRIG_POLARITY
parameter.long_desc: This parameter sets the polarity of the trigger (0 = active low, 1 = active high )

parameter.name: TRIG_PWM_NEUTRAL
parameter.short_desc: PWM neutral output on trigger pin

parameter.name: CBRK_AIRSPD_CHK
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 162128 will disable the check for an airspeed sensor. The sensor driver will not be started and it cannot be calibrated. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_BUZZER
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 782097 will disable the buzzer audio notification. Setting this parameter to 782090 will disable the startup tune, while keeping all others enabled.

parameter.name: CBRK_ENGINEFAIL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for engine failure detection
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 284953 will disable the engine failure detection. If the aircraft is in engine failure mode the engine failure flag will be set to healthy WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_FLIGHTTERM
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 121212 will disable the flight termination action if triggered by the FailureDetector logic or if FMU is lost. This circuit breaker does not affect the RC loss, data link loss, geofence, and takeoff failure detection safety logic.

parameter.name: CBRK_IO_SAFETY
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 22027 will disable IO safety. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_RATE_CTRL
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for rate controller output
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 140253 will disable the rate controller uORB publication. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for power supply check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 894281 will disable the power valid checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_USB_CHK
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for USB link check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 197848 will disable the USB connected checks in the commander, setting it to 0 keeps them enabled (recommended). We are generally recommending to not fly with the USB link connected and production vehicles should set this parameter to zero to prevent users from flying USB powered. However, for R&D purposes it has proven over the years to work just fine.

parameter.name: CBRK_VELPOSERR
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for position error check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 201607 will disable the position and velocity accuracy checks in the commander. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: CBRK_VTOLARMING
parameter.short_desc: Circuit breaker for arming in fixed-wing mode check
parameter.long_desc: Setting this parameter to 159753 will enable arming in fixed-wing mode for VTOLs. WARNING: ENABLING THIS CIRCUIT BREAKER IS AT OWN RISK

parameter.name: COM_ARM_ARSP_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable preflight check for maximal allowed airspeed when arming
parameter.long_desc: Deny arming if the current airspeed measurement is greater than half the cruise airspeed (FW_AIRSPD_TRIM). Excessive airspeed measurements on ground are either caused by wind or bad airspeed calibration.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_ID
parameter.long_desc: Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_MET
parameter.long_desc: Methods: - one arm: request authorization and arm when authorization is received - two step arm: 1st arm command request an authorization and 2nd arm command arm the drone if authorized Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ
parameter.long_desc: By default off. The default allows to arm the vehicle without a arm authorization.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_AUTH_TO
parameter.long_desc: Timeout for authorizer answer. Used if arm authorization is requested by COM_ARM_AUTH_REQ.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_CHK_ESCS
parameter.short_desc: Enable checks on ESCs that report telemetry
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is set, the system will check ESC's online status and failures. This param is specific for ESCs reporting status. It shall be used only if ESCs support telemetry.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_HGT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF height innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_POS
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF position innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF velocity innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_EKF_YAW
parameter.short_desc: Maximum EKF yaw innovation test ratio that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_IMU_ACC
parameter.short_desc: Maximum accelerometer inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_IMU_GYR
parameter.short_desc: Maximum rate gyro inconsistency between IMU units that will allow arming

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MAG_ANG
parameter.short_desc: Maximum magnetic field inconsistency between units that will allow arming
parameter.long_desc: Set -1 to disable the check.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MAG_STR
parameter.long_desc: Check if the estimator detects a strong magnetic disturbance (check enabled by EKF2_MAG_CHECK)

parameter.name: COM_ARM_MIS_REQ
parameter.long_desc: The default allows to arm the vehicle without a valid mission.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_SDCARD
parameter.short_desc: Enable FMU SD card detection check
parameter.long_desc: This check detects if the FMU SD card is missing. Depending on the value of the parameter, the check can be disabled, warn only or deny arming.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_SWISBTN
parameter.short_desc: Arm switch is a momentary button
parameter.long_desc: 0: Arming/disarming triggers on switch transition. 1: Arming/disarming triggers when holding the momentary button down for COM_RC_ARM_HYST like the stick gesture.

parameter.name: COM_ARM_WO_GPS
parameter.long_desc: The default allows the vehicle to arm without GPS signal.

parameter.name: COM_CPU_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum allowed CPU load to still arm
parameter.long_desc: A negative value disables the check.

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_LAND
parameter.short_desc: Time-out for auto disarm after landing
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time-out period in seconds after which the vehicle will be automatically disarmed in case a landing situation has been detected during this period. A zero or negative value means that automatic disarming triggered by landing detection is disabled.

parameter.name: COM_DISARM_PRFLT
parameter.short_desc: Time-out for auto disarm if not taking off
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the time in seconds, within which the vehicle is expected to take off after arming. In case the vehicle didn't takeoff within the timeout it disarms again. A negative value disables autmoatic disarming triggered by a pre-takeoff timeout.

parameter.name: COM_DL_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_EF_C2T
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only below this current value

parameter.name: COM_EF_THROT
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only above this throttle value

parameter.name: COM_EF_TIME
parameter.long_desc: Engine failure triggers only if the throttle threshold and the current to throttle threshold are violated for this time

parameter.name: COM_FLIGHT_UUID
parameter.long_desc: This number is incremented automatically after every flight on disarming in order to remember the next flight UUID. The first flight is 0.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE1
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE2
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE3
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE4
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE5
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLTMODE6
parameter.long_desc: If the main switch channel is in this range the selected flight mode will be applied.

parameter.name: COM_FLT_PROFILE
parameter.long_desc: Describes the intended use of the vehicle. Can be used by ground control software or log post processing. This param does not influence the behavior within the firmware. This means for example the control logic is independent of the setting of this param (but depends on other params).

parameter.name: COM_HLDL_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: High Latency Datalink loss time threshold
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without datalink the data link lost mode triggers

parameter.name: COM_HLDL_REG_T
parameter.short_desc: High Latency Datalink regain time threshold
parameter.long_desc: After a data link loss: after this number of seconds with a healthy datalink the 'datalink loss' flag is set back to false

parameter.name: COM_HOME_H_T
parameter.long_desc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_HOME_IN_AIR
parameter.short_desc: Allows setting the home position after takeoff
parameter.long_desc: If set to true, the autopilot is allowed to set its home position after takeoff The true home position is back-computed if a local position is estimate if available. If no local position is available, home is set to the current position.

parameter.name: COM_HOME_V_T
parameter.long_desc: The home position will be set if the estimated positioning accuracy is below the threshold.

parameter.name: COM_IMB_PROP_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes when an imbalanced propeller is detected by the failure detector. See also FD_IMB_PROP_THR to set the failure threshold.

parameter.name: COM_KILL_DISARM
parameter.short_desc: Timeout value for disarming when kill switch is engaged

parameter.name: COM_LKDOWN_TKO
parameter.short_desc: Timeout for detecting a failure after takeoff
parameter.long_desc: A non-zero, positive value specifies the timeframe in seconds within failure detector is allowed to put the vehicle into a lockdown state if attitude exceeds the limits defined in FD_FAIL_P and FD_FAIL_R. The check is not executed for flight modes that do support acrobatic maneuvers, e.g: Acro (MC/FW) and Manual (FW). A zero or negative value means that the check is disabled.

parameter.name: COM_LOW_BAT_ACT
parameter.long_desc: Action the system takes at critical battery. See also BAT_CRIT_THR and BAT_EMERGEN_THR for definition of battery states.

values.value: Return at critical level, land at emergency level

parameter.name: COM_MOT_TEST_EN
parameter.long_desc: If set, enables the motor test interface via MAVLink (DO_MOTOR_TEST), that allows spinning the motors for testing purposes.

parameter.name: COM_OBC_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: Time-out to wait when onboard computer connection is lost before warning about loss connection

parameter.name: COM_OBL_ACT
parameter.long_desc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameter.name: COM_OBL_RC_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Set offboard loss failsafe mode when RC is available
parameter.long_desc: The offboard loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_OF_LOSS_T in seconds.

parameter.name: COM_OF_LOSS_T
parameter.short_desc: Time-out to wait when offboard connection is lost before triggering offboard lost action
parameter.long_desc: See COM_OBL_ACT and COM_OBL_RC_ACT to configure action.

parameter.name: COM_PARACHUTE
parameter.short_desc: Expect and require a healthy MAVLink parachute system

parameter.name: COM_POSCTL_NAVL
parameter.long_desc: This sets the flight mode that will be used if navigation accuracy is no longer adequate for position control. Navigation accuracy checks can be disabled using the CBRK_VELPOSERR parameter, but doing so will remove protection for all flight modes.

values.value: Altitude/Manual. Assume use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Altitude mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to MANUAL.
Land/Terminate. Assume no use of remote control after fallback. Switch to Land mode if a height estimate is available, else switch to TERMINATION.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Loss of position failsafe activation delay
parameter.long_desc: This sets number of seconds that the position checks need to be failed before the failsafe will activate. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a larger value between 5 and 10 should be used.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_EPH
parameter.long_desc: This is the horizontal position error (EPH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_EPV
parameter.long_desc: This is the vertical position error (EPV) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_GAIN
parameter.short_desc: Loss of position probation gain factor
parameter.long_desc: This sets the rate that the loss of position probation time grows when position checks are failing. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications a value of 0 should be used.

parameter.name: COM_POS_FS_PROB
parameter.short_desc: Loss of position probation delay at takeoff
parameter.long_desc: The probation delay is the number of seconds that the EKF innovation checks need to pass for the position to be declared good after it has been declared bad. The probation delay will be reset to this parameter value when takeoff is detected. After takeoff, if position checks are passing, the probation delay will reduce by one second for every lapsed second of valid position down to a minimum of 1 second. If position checks are failing, the probation delay will increase by COM_POS_FS_GAIN seconds for every lapsed second up to a maximum of 100 seconds. The default value has been optimised for rotary wing applications. For fixed wing applications, a value of 1 should be used.

parameter.name: COM_POWER_COUNT
parameter.short_desc: Required number of redundant power modules
parameter.long_desc: This configures a check to verify the expected number of 5V rail power supplies are present. By default only one is expected. Note: CBRK_SUPPLY_CHK disables all power checks including this one.

parameter.name: COM_PREARM_MODE
parameter.long_desc: Condition to enter the prearmed state, an intermediate state between disarmed and armed in which non-throttling actuators are active.

parameter.name: COM_RCL_ACT_T
parameter.short_desc: Delay between RC loss and configured reaction
parameter.long_desc: RC signal not updated -> still use data for COM_RC_LOSS_T seconds Consider RC signal lost -> wait COM_RCL_ACT_T seconds on the spot waiting to regain signal React with failsafe action NAV_RCL_ACT A zero value disables the delay.

parameter.name: COM_RCL_EXCEPT
parameter.long_desc: Specify modes in which RC loss is ignored and the failsafe action not triggered.

parameter.name: COM_RC_ARM_HYST
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 1000 requires the stick to be held in the arm or disarm position for 1 second.

parameter.name: COM_RC_IN_MODE
parameter.long_desc: The default value of 0 requires a valid RC transmitter setup. Setting this to 1 allows joystick control and disables RC input handling and the associated checks. A value of 2 will generate RC control data from manual input received via MAVLink instead of directly forwarding the manual input data.

parameter.name: COM_RC_LOSS_T
parameter.long_desc: After this amount of seconds without RC connection it's considered lost and not used anymore

parameter.name: COM_RC_OVERRIDE
parameter.short_desc: Enable RC stick override of auto and/or offboard modes
parameter.long_desc: When RC stick override is enabled, moving the RC sticks more than COM_RC_STICK_OV immediately gives control back to the pilot by switching to Position mode and if position is unavailable Altitude mode. Note: Only has an effect on multicopters, and VTOLs in multicopter mode. This parameter is not considered in case of a GPS failure (Descend flight mode), where stick override is always enabled.

bitmask.bit: Enable override during auto modes (except for in critical battery reaction)

parameter.name: COM_RC_STICK_OV
parameter.long_desc: If COM_RC_OVERRIDE is enabled and the joystick input is moved more than this threshold the autopilot the pilot takes over control.

parameter.name: COM_REARM_GRACE
parameter.long_desc: Re-arming grace allows to rearm the drone with manual command without running prearmcheck during 5 s after disarming.

parameter.name: COM_TAKEOFF_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Action after TAKEOFF has been accepted
parameter.long_desc: The mode transition after TAKEOFF has completed successfully.

parameter.name: COM_VEL_FS_EVH
parameter.long_desc: This is the horizontal velocity error (EVH) threshold that will trigger a failsafe. The default is appropriate for a multicopter. Can be increased for a fixed-wing.

parameter.name: COM_WIND_WARN
parameter.long_desc: A warning is triggered if the currently estimated wind speed is above this value. Warning is sent periodically (every 1min). A negative value disables the feature.

parameter.name: NAV_DLL_ACT
parameter.short_desc: Set data link loss failsafe mode
parameter.long_desc: The data link loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_DL_LOSS_T in seconds. Once the timeout occurs the selected action will be executed.

parameter.name: NAV_RCL_ACT
parameter.long_desc: The RC loss failsafe will only be entered after a timeout, set by COM_RC_LOSS_T in seconds. If RC input checks have been disabled by setting the COM_RC_IN_MODE param it will not be triggered.

parameter.name: NAV_AH_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Altitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LAT
parameter.long_desc: Latitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: NAV_AH_LON
parameter.long_desc: Longitude of airfield home waypoint

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_ACCLIM
parameter.short_desc: Maximum IMU accel magnitude that allows IMU bias learning
parameter.long_desc: If the magnitude of the IMU accelerometer vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of high manoeuvre accelerations and IMU nonlinerity and scale factor errors on the delta velocity bias estimates.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_GYRLIM
parameter.short_desc: Maximum IMU gyro angular rate magnitude that allows IMU bias learning
parameter.long_desc: If the magnitude of the IMU angular rate vector exceeds this value, the EKF delta velocity state estimation will be inhibited. This reduces the adverse effect of rapid rotation rates and associated errors on the delta velocity bias estimates.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The ekf delta velocity bias states will be limited to within a range equivalent to +- of this value.

parameter.name: EKF2_ABL_TAU
parameter.short_desc: Time constant used by acceleration and angular rate magnitude checks used to inhibit delta velocity bias learning
parameter.long_desc: The vector magnitude of angular rate and acceleration used to check if learning should be inhibited has a peak hold filter applied to it with an exponential decay. This parameter controls the time constant of the decay.

parameter.name: EKF2_ACC_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for IMU accelerometer bias prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_AID_MASK
parameter.short_desc: Integer bitmask controlling data fusion and aiding methods
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to use GPS data if available 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available 2 : Set to true to inhibit IMU delta velocity bias estimation 3 : Set to true to enable vision position fusion 4 : Set to true to enable vision yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 7 is true. 5 : Set to true to enable multi-rotor drag specific force fusion 6 : set to true if the EV observations are in a non NED reference frame and need to be rotated before being used 7 : Set to true to enable GPS yaw fusion. Cannot be used if bit position 4 is true.

parameter.name: EKF2_ANGERR_INIT
parameter.short_desc: 1-sigma tilt angle uncertainty after gravity vector alignment

parameter.name: EKF2_ARSP_THR
parameter.long_desc: A value of zero will deactivate airspeed fusion. Any other positive value will determine the minimum airspeed which will still be fused. Set to about 90% of the vehicles stall speed. Both airspeed fusion and sideslip fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_FUSE_BETA to activate sideslip fusion.

parameter.name: EKF2_ASPD_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Upper limit on airspeed along individual axes used to correct baro for position error effects

parameter.name: EKF2_ASP_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_AVEL_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Auxillary Velocity Estimate (e.g from a landing target) delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Barometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_BARO_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for barometric and GPS height fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_BCOEF_X
parameter.short_desc: X-axis ballistic coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by bluff body drag along the forward/reverse axis when flying a multi-copter which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter. The EKF2_BCOEF_X paraemter should be set initially to the ratio of mass / projected frontal area and adjusted together with EKF2_MCOEF to minimise variance of the X-axis drag specific force innovation sequence. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. Set this parameter to zero to turn off the bluff body drag model for this axis. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EKF2_MCOEF parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_BCOEF_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y-axis ballistic coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by bluff body drag along the right/left axis when flying a multi-copter, which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter. The EKF2_BCOEF_Y paraemter should be set initially to the ratio of mass / projected side area and adjusted together with EKF2_MCOEF to minimise variance of the Y-axis drag specific force innovation sequence. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed squared. et this parameter to zero to turn off the bluff body drag model for this axis. The predicted drag from the rotors is specified separately by the EKF2_MCOEF parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_BETA_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for synthetic sideslip fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_DECL_TYPE
parameter.short_desc: Integer bitmask controlling handling of magnetic declination
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable functions. 0 : Set to true to use the declination from the geo_lookup library when the GPS position becomes available, set to false to always use the EKF2_MAG_DECL value. 1 : Set to true to save the EKF2_MAG_DECL parameter to the value returned by the EKF when the vehicle disarms. 2 : Set to true to always use the declination as an observation when 3-axis magnetometer fusion is being used.

parameter.name: EKF2_DRAG_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Specific drag force observation noise variance used by the multi-rotor specific drag force model
parameter.long_desc: Increasing this makes the multi-rotor wind estimates adjust more slowly.

parameter.name: EKF2_EVA_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision angle observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_EVP_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for vision position fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_EVP_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision position observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_EVV_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for vision velocity estimate fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_EVV_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for vision velocity observations used to lower bound or replace the uncertainty included in the message

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Vision Position Estimator delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_NOISE_MD
parameter.short_desc: Whether to set the external vision observation noise from the parameter or from vision message
parameter.long_desc: If set to true the observation noise is set from the parameters directly, if set to false the measurement noise is taken from the vision message and the parameter are used as a lower bound.

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_EV_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of VI sensor focal point in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_FUSE_BETA
parameter.short_desc: Boolean determining if synthetic sideslip measurements should fused
parameter.long_desc: A value of 1 indicates that fusion is active Both sideslip fusion and airspeed fusion must be active for the EKF to continue navigating after loss of GPS. Use EKF2_ARSP_THR to activate airspeed fusion.

parameter.name: EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ
parameter.short_desc: Baro deadzone range for height fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the value of deadzone applied to negative baro innovations. Deadzone is enabled when EKF2_GND_EFF_DZ > 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_GND_MAX_HGT
parameter.short_desc: Height above ground level for ground effect zone
parameter.long_desc: Sets the maximum distance to the ground level where negative baro innovations are expected.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_CHECK
parameter.long_desc: Set bits to 1 to enable checks. Checks enabled by the following bit positions 0 : Minimum required sat count set by EKF2_REQ_NSATS 1 : Maximum allowed PDOP set by EKF2_REQ_PDOP 2 : Maximum allowed horizontal position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPH 3 : Maximum allowed vertical position error set by EKF2_REQ_EPV 4 : Maximum allowed speed error set by EKF2_REQ_SACC 5 : Maximum allowed horizontal position rate set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 6 : Maximum allowed vertical position rate set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 7 : Maximum allowed horizontal speed set by EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT. This check will only run when the vehicle is on ground and stationary. Detecton of the stationary condition is controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter. 8 : Maximum allowed vertical velocity discrepancy set by EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: GPS measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of GPS antenna in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of GPS antenna in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of GPS antenna in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_P_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for GPS horizontal position fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_V_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for GPS velocity fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_GPS_V_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for gps horizontal velocity

parameter.name: EKF2_GSF_TAS
parameter.short_desc: Default value of true airspeed used in EKF-GSF AHRS calculation
parameter.long_desc: If no airspeed measurements are avalable, the EKF-GSF AHRS calculation will assume this value of true airspeed when compensating for centripetal acceleration during turns. Set to zero to disable centripetal acceleration compensation during fixed wing flight modes.

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for IMU rate gyro bias prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_GYR_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Rate gyro noise for covariance prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_HDG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for magnetic heading fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_HEAD_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for magnetic heading fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_HGT_MODE
parameter.short_desc: Determines the primary source of height data used by the EKF
parameter.long_desc: The range sensor option should only be used when for operation over a flat surface as the local NED origin will move up and down with ground level.

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of IMU in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of IMU in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_IMU_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of IMU in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_ACCLIM
parameter.short_desc: Horizontal acceleration threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered horizontal acceleration is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_B_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for body magnetic field prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_CHECK
parameter.long_desc: When set, the EKF checks the strength of the magnetic field to decide whether the magnetometer data is valid. If GPS data is received, the magnetic field is compared to a World Magnetic Model (WMM), otherwise an average value is used. This check is useful to reject occasional hard iron disturbance.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Magnetometer measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_E_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for earth magnetic field prediction

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for magnetometer XYZ component fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_TYPE
parameter.long_desc: Integer controlling the type of magnetometer fusion used - magnetic heading or 3-component vector. The fuson of magnetomer data as a three component vector enables vehicle body fixed hard iron errors to be learned, but requires a stable earth field. If set to 'Automatic' magnetic heading fusion is used when on-ground and 3-axis magnetic field fusion in-flight with fallback to magnetic heading fusion if there is insufficient motion to make yaw or magnetic field states observable. If set to 'Magnetic heading' magnetic heading fusion is used at all times If set to '3-axis' 3-axis field fusion is used at all times. If set to 'VTOL custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic', but if fusing airspeed, magnetometer fusion is only allowed to modify the magnetic field states. This can be used by VTOL platforms with large magnetic field disturbances to prevent incorrect bias states being learned during forward flight operation which can adversely affect estimation accuracy after transition to hovering flight. If set to 'MC custom' the behaviour is the same as 'Automatic, but if there are no earth frame position or velocity observations being used, the magnetometer will not be used. This enables vehicles to operate with no GPS in environments where the magnetic field cannot be used to provide a heading reference. Prior to flight, the yaw angle is assumed to be constant if movement tests controlled by the EKF2_MOVE_TEST parameter indicate that the vehicle is static. This allows the vehicle to be placed on the ground to learn the yaw gyro bias prior to flight. If set to 'None' the magnetometer will not be used under any circumstance. If no external source of yaw is available, it is possible to use post-takeoff horizontal movement combined with GPS velocity measurements to align the yaw angle with the timer required (depending on the amount of movement and GPS data quality). Other external sources of yaw may be used if selected via the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_MAG_YAWLIM
parameter.short_desc: Yaw rate threshold used by automatic selection of magnetometer fusion method
parameter.long_desc: This parameter is used when the magnetometer fusion method is set automatically (EKF2_MAG_TYPE = 0). If the filtered yaw rate is greater than this parameter value, then the EKF will use 3-axis magnetomer fusion.

parameter.name: EKF2_MCOEF
parameter.short_desc: propeller momentum drag coefficient used for multi-rotor wind estimation
parameter.long_desc: This parameter controls the prediction of drag produced by the propellers when flying a multi-copter, which enables estimation of wind drift when enabled by the EKF2_AID_MASK parameter. The drag produced by this effect scales with speed not speed squared and is produced because some of the air velocity normal to the propeller axis of rotation is lost when passing through the rotor disc. This changes the momentum of the flow which creates a drag reaction force. When comparing un-ducted propellers of the same diameter, the effect is roughly proportional to the area of the propeller blades when viewed side on and changes with propeller selection. Momentum drag is significantly higher for ducted rotors. For example, if flying at 10 m/s at sea level conditions produces a rotor induced drag deceleration of 1.5 m/s/s when the multi-copter levelled to zero roll/pitch, then EKF2_MCOEF would be set to 0.15 = (1.5/10.0). Set EKF2_MCOEF to a positive value to enable wind estimation using this drag effect. To account for the drag produced by the body which scales with speed squared, see documentation for the EKF2_BCOEF_X and EKF2_BCOEF_Y parameters. The EKF2_MCOEF parameter should be adjusted together with EKF2_BCOEF_X and EKF2_BCOEF_Y to minimise variance of the X and y axis drag specific force innovation sequences.

parameter.name: EKF2_MIN_OBS_DT
parameter.short_desc: Minimum time of arrival delta between non-IMU observations before data is downsampled
parameter.long_desc: Baro and Magnetometer data will be averaged before downsampling, other data will be point sampled resulting in loss of information.

parameter.name: EKF2_MIN_RNG
parameter.short_desc: Expected range finder reading when on ground
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle is on ground, is not moving as determined by the motion test controlled by EKF2_MOVE_TEST and the range finder is returning invalid or no data, then an assumed range value of EKF2_MIN_RNG will be used by the terrain estimator so that a terrain height estimate is avilable at the start of flight in situations where the range finder may be inside its minimum measurements distance when on ground.

parameter.name: EKF2_MOVE_TEST
parameter.long_desc: Scales the threshold tests applied to IMU data used to determine if the vehicle is static or moving. See parameter descriptions for EKF2_GPS_CHECK and EKF2_MAG_TYPE for further information on the functionality affected by this parameter.

parameter.name: EKF2_MULTI_IMU
parameter.long_desc: Maximum number of IMUs to use for Multi-EKF. Set 0 to disable. Requires SENS_IMU_MODE 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_MULTI_MAG
parameter.long_desc: Maximum number of magnetometers to use for Multi-EKF. Set 0 to disable. Requires SENS_MAG_MODE 0.

parameter.name: EKF2_NOAID_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for non-aiding position hold

parameter.name: EKF2_NOAID_TOUT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum lapsed time from last fusion of measurements that constrain velocity drift before the EKF will report the horizontal nav solution as invalid

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Optical flow measurement delay relative to IMU measurements
parameter.long_desc: Assumes measurement is timestamped at trailing edge of integration period

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for optical flow fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_N_MAX
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor
parameter.long_desc: (when it's reported quality metric is at the minimum set by EKF2_OF_QMIN). The following condition must be met: EKF2_OF_N_MAXN >= EKF2_OF_N_MIN

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_N_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for the optical flow sensor when it's reported quality metric is at the maximum

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of optical flow focal point in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of optical flow focal point in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of optical flow focal point in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_OF_QMIN
parameter.short_desc: Optical Flow data will only be used if the sensor reports a quality metric >= EKF2_OF_QMIN

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XN
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the negative X axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_XP
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the positive X axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forward flight, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YN
parameter.short_desc: Pressure position error coefficient for the negative Y axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the negative Y (LH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_YP
parameter.short_desc: Pressure position error coefficient for the positive Y axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the positive Y (RH) body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this will be a negative number.

parameter.name: EKF2_PCOEF_Z
parameter.short_desc: Static pressure position error coefficient for the Z axis
parameter.long_desc: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a wind relative velocity along the Z body axis.

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_GPS_H
parameter.short_desc: Required GPS health time on startup
parameter.long_desc: Minimum continuous period without GPS failure required to mark a healthy GPS status. It can be reduced to speed up initialization, but it's recommended to keep this unchanged for a vehicle.

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_HDRIFT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal drift speed to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_NSATS
parameter.short_desc: Required satellite count to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_SACC
parameter.short_desc: Required speed accuracy to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_REQ_VDRIFT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum vertical drift speed to use GPS

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_AID
parameter.long_desc: If this parameter is enabled then the estimator will make use of the range finder measurements to estimate it's height even if range sensor is not the primary height source. It will only do so if conditions for range measurement fusion are met. This enables the range finder to be used during low speed and low altitude operation, eg takeoff and landing, where baro interference from rotor wash is excessive and can corrupt EKF state estimates. It is intended to be used where a vertical takeoff and landing is performed, and horizontal flight does not occur until above EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX. If vehicle motion causes repeated switching between the primary height sensor and range finder, an offset in the local position origin can accumulate. Also range finder measurements are less reliable and can experience unexpected errors. For these reasons, if accurate control of height relative to ground is required, it is recommended to use the MPC_ALT_MODE parameter instead, unless baro errors are severe enough to cause problems with landing and takeoff.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_HMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum absolute altitude (height above ground level) allowed for range aid mode
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle absolute altitude exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_AID = enabled).

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_IGATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size used for innovation consistency checks for range aid fusion
parameter.long_desc: A lower value means HAGL needs to be more stable in order to use range finder for height estimation in range aid mode

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_A_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum horizontal velocity allowed for range aid mode
parameter.long_desc: If the vehicle horizontal speed exceeds this value then the estimator will not fuse range measurements to estimate it's height. This only applies when range aid mode is activated (EKF2_RNG_AID = enabled).

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_DELAY
parameter.short_desc: Range finder measurement delay relative to IMU measurements

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_GATE
parameter.short_desc: Gate size for range finder fusion
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Measurement noise for range finder fusion

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_X
parameter.short_desc: X position of range finder origin in body frame (forward axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Y
parameter.short_desc: Y position of range finder origin in body frame (right axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_POS_Z
parameter.short_desc: Z position of range finder origin in body frame (down axis with origin relative to vehicle centre of gravity)

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_QLTY_T
parameter.short_desc: Minimum duration during which the reported range finder signal quality needs to be non-zero in order to be declared valid (s)

parameter.name: EKF2_RNG_SFE
parameter.short_desc: Range finder range dependant noise scaler
parameter.long_desc: Specifies the increase in range finder noise with range.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_ERR_RED
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 instances have to be better than the selected by at least this amount before their relative score can be reduced.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_ACC
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector acceleration error threshold for comparing accelerometers. Acceleration vector differences larger than this will result in accumulated velocity error.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_ANG
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector maximum accumulated angular error threshold for comparing gyros. Accumulated angular error larger than this will result in the sensor being declared faulty.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_RAT
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector angular rate error threshold for comparing gyros. Angular rate vector differences larger than this will result in accumulated angular error.

parameter.name: EKF2_SEL_IMU_VEL
parameter.long_desc: EKF2 selector maximum accumulated velocity threshold for comparing accelerometers. Accumulated velocity error larger than this will result in the sensor being declared faulty.

parameter.name: EKF2_SYNT_MAG_Z
parameter.short_desc: Enable synthetic magnetometer Z component measurement
parameter.long_desc: Use for vehicles where the measured body Z magnetic field is subject to strong magnetic interference. For magnetic heading fusion the magnetometer Z measurement will be replaced by a synthetic value calculated using the knowledge of the 3D magnetic field vector at the location of the drone. Therefore, this parameter will only have an effect if the global position of the drone is known. For 3D mag fusion the magnetometer Z measurement will simply be ingored instead of fusing the synthetic value.

parameter.name: EKF2_TAS_GATE
parameter.long_desc: Sets the number of standard deviations used by the innovation consistency test.

parameter.name: EKF2_TAU_POS
parameter.short_desc: Time constant of the position output prediction and smoothing filter. Controls how tightly the output track the EKF states

parameter.name: EKF2_TAU_VEL
parameter.short_desc: Time constant of the velocity output prediction and smoothing filter

parameter.name: EKF2_TERR_MASK
parameter.short_desc: Integer bitmask controlling fusion sources of the terrain estimator
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to enable: 0 : Set to true to use range finder data if available 1 : Set to true to use optical flow data if available

parameter.name: EKF2_TERR_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Terrain altitude process noise - accounts for instability in vehicle height estimate

parameter.name: EKF2_WIND_NOISE
parameter.short_desc: Process noise for wind velocity prediction

parameter.name: EV_TSK_RC_LOSS
parameter.long_desc: Enable/disable event task for RC Loss. When enabled, an alarm tune will be played via buzzer or ESCs, if supported. The alarm will sound after a disarm, if the vehicle was previously armed and only if the vehicle had RC signal at some point. Particularly useful for locating crashed drones without a GPS sensor.

parameter.name: EV_TSK_STAT_DIS
parameter.long_desc: Enable/disable event task for displaying the vehicle status using arm-mounted LEDs. When enabled and if the vehicle supports it, LEDs will flash indicating various vehicle status changes. Currently PX4 has not implemented any specific status events. -

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_X_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full roll stick input in acro mode.

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_Y_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the body y rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full pitch stick input in acro mode.

parameter.name: FW_ACRO_Z_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the body z rate the controller is trying to achieve if the user applies full yaw stick input in acro mode.

parameter.name: FW_ARSP_MODE
parameter.long_desc: For small wings or VTOL without airspeed sensor this parameter can be used to enable flying without an airspeed reading

parameter.name: FW_ARSP_SCALE_EN
parameter.long_desc: This enables a logic that automatically adjusts the output of the rate controller to take into account the real torque produced by an aerodynamic control surface given the current deviation from the trim airspeed (FW_AIRSPD_TRIM). Enable when using aerodynamic control surfaces (e.g.: plane) Disable when using rotor wings (e.g.: autogyro)

parameter.name: FW_BAT_SCALE_EN
parameter.short_desc: Whether to scale throttle by battery power level
parameter.long_desc: This compensates for voltage drop of the battery over time by attempting to normalize performance across the operating range of the battery. The fixed wing should constantly behave as if it was fully charged with reduced max thrust at lower battery percentages. i.e. if cruise speed is at 0.5 throttle at 100% battery, it will still be 0.5 at 60% battery.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_FLPS
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment for flaps configuration
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to the pitch trim whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_P_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Pitch trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_PITCH when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_FLPS
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment for flaps configuration
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL whenever flaps are fully deployed.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_R_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Roll trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_ROLL when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMAX
parameter.short_desc: Yaw trim increment at maximum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MAX.

parameter.name: FW_DTRIM_Y_VMIN
parameter.short_desc: Yaw trim increment at minimum airspeed
parameter.long_desc: This increment is added to TRIM_YAW when airspeed is FW_AIRSPD_MIN.

parameter.name: FW_FLAPS_LND_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Sets a fraction of full flaps (FW_FLAPS_SCL) during landing

parameter.name: FW_FLAPS_TO_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Sets a fraction of full flaps (FW_FLAPS_SCL) during take-off

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max pitch for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_MAN_P_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired pitch actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_MAX
parameter.long_desc: Max roll for manual control in attitude stabilized mode

parameter.name: FW_MAN_R_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired roll actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_MAN_Y_SC
parameter.long_desc: Scale factor applied to the desired yaw actuator command in full manual mode. This parameter allows to adjust the throws of the control surfaces.

parameter.name: FW_PR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_PR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_PR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_PR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the elevator input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_PSP_OFF
parameter.short_desc: Pitch setpoint offset (pitch at level flight)
parameter.long_desc: An airframe specific offset of the pitch setpoint in degrees, the value is added to the pitch setpoint and should correspond to the pitch at typical cruise speed of the airframe.

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_NEG
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch down up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_P_RMAX_POS
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum pitch up angular rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_P_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a pitch step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_RLL_TO_YAW_FF
parameter.short_desc: Roll control to yaw control feedforward gain
parameter.long_desc: This gain can be used to counteract the "adverse yaw" effect for fixed wings. When the plane enters a roll it will tend to yaw the nose out of the turn. This gain enables the use of a yaw actuator (rudder, airbrakes, ...) to counteract this effect.

parameter.name: FW_RR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output. Use this to obtain a tigher response of the controller without introducing noise amplification.

parameter.name: FW_RR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_RR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value.

parameter.name: FW_RR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the aileron input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_R_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum roll rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_R_TC
parameter.long_desc: This defines the latency between a roll step input and the achieved setpoint (inverse to a P gain). Half a second is a good start value and fits for most average systems. Smaller systems may require smaller values, but as this will wear out servos faster, the value should only be decreased as needed.

parameter.name: FW_WR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_WR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_WR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_WR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the wheel steering input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_W_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum wheel steering rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_YR_FF
parameter.long_desc: Direct feed forward from rate setpoint to control surface output

parameter.name: FW_YR_I
parameter.long_desc: This gain defines how much control response will result out of a steady state error. It trims any constant error.

parameter.name: FW_YR_IMAX
parameter.long_desc: The portion of the integrator part in the control surface deflection is limited to this value

parameter.name: FW_YR_P
parameter.long_desc: This defines how much the rudder input will be commanded depending on the current body angular rate error.

parameter.name: FW_Y_RMAX
parameter.long_desc: This limits the maximum yaw rate the controller will output (in degrees per second).

parameter.name: FW_CLMBOUT_DIFF
parameter.long_desc: If the altitude error exceeds this parameter, the system will climb out with maximum throttle and minimum airspeed until it is closer than this distance to the desired altitude. Mostly used for takeoff waypoints / modes. Set to 0 to disable climbout mode (not recommended).

parameter.name: FW_L1_DAMPING
parameter.long_desc: Damping factor for L1 control.

parameter.name: FW_L1_PERIOD
parameter.long_desc: Used to determine the L1 gain and controller time constant. This parameter is proportional to the L1 distance (which points ahead of the aircraft on the path it is following). A value of 18-25 seconds works for most aircraft. Shorten slowly during tuning until response is sharp without oscillation.

parameter.name: FW_L1_R_SLEW_MAX
parameter.short_desc: L1 controller roll slew rate limit
parameter.long_desc: The maxium change in roll angle setpoint per second.

parameter.name: FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC
parameter.short_desc: Min. airspeed scaling factor for landing
parameter.long_desc: Multiplying this factor with the minimum airspeed of the plane gives the target airspeed the landing approach. FW_AIRSPD_MIN * FW_LND_AIRSPD_SC

parameter.name: FW_LND_EARLYCFG
parameter.long_desc: When disabled, the landing configuration (flaps, landing airspeed, etc.) is only activated on the final approach to landing. When enabled, it is already activated when entering the final loiter-down (loiter-to-alt) waypoint before the landing approach. This shifts the (often large) altitude and airspeed errors caused by the configuration change away from the ground such that these are not so critical. It also gives the controller enough time to adapt to the new configuration such that the landing approach starts with a cleaner initial state.

parameter.name: FW_LND_FLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing flare altitude (relative to landing altitude)

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_PMAX
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_FLALT is reached

parameter.name: FW_LND_FL_PMIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum pitch during flare, a positive sign means nose up Applied once FW_LND_FLALT is reached

parameter.name: FW_LND_HHDIST
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable heading hold.

parameter.name: FW_LND_THRTC_SC
parameter.short_desc: Altitude time constant factor for landing
parameter.long_desc: Set this parameter to less than 1.0 to make TECS react faster to altitude errors during landing than during normal flight (i.e. giving efficiency and low motor wear at high altitudes but control accuracy during landing). During landing, the TECS altitude time constant (FW_T_ALT_TC) is multiplied by this value.

parameter.name: FW_LND_TLALT
parameter.short_desc: Landing throttle limit altitude (relative landing altitude)
parameter.long_desc: Default of -1.0 lets the system default to applying throttle limiting at 2/3 of the flare altitude.

parameter.name: FW_LND_USETER
parameter.long_desc: This is turned off by default and a waypoint or return altitude is normally used (or sea level for an arbitrary land position).

parameter.name: FW_POSCTL_INV_ST
parameter.long_desc: Set RC/joystick configuration for fixed-wing position and altitude controlled flight.

values.value: Normal stick configuration (airspeed on throttle stick, altitude on pitch stick)
Alternative stick configuration (altitude on throttle stick, airspeed on pitch stick)

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MAX
parameter.long_desc: The maximum positive pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_P_LIM_MIN
parameter.long_desc: The minimum negative pitch the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_R_LIM
parameter.long_desc: The maximum roll the controller will output.

parameter.name: FW_THR_ALT_SCL
parameter.long_desc: Automatically adjust throttle to account for decreased air density at higher altitudes. Start with a scale factor of 1.0 and adjust for different propulsion systems.
