parameter.short_desc: ID of the Accelerometer that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_ACC2_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of accelerometer 2 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC2_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC3_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Accelerometer that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_ACC3_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of accelerometer 3 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_ACC3_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO0_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO0_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of gyro 0 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO0_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO1_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO1_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of gyro 1 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO1_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO2_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO2_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of gyro 2 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO2_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO3_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of the Gyro that the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO3_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of gyro 3 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_GYRO3_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 0 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_XCOMP
parameter.short_desc: X Axis throttle compensation for Mag 0
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_YCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Y Axis throttle compensation for Mag 0
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG0_ZCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Z Axis throttle compensation for Mag 0
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 1 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_XCOMP
parameter.short_desc: X Axis throttle compensation for Mag 1
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_YCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Y Axis throttle compensation for Mag 1
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG1_ZCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Z Axis throttle compensation for Mag 1
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 2 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_XCOMP
parameter.short_desc: X Axis throttle compensation for Mag 2
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_YCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Y Axis throttle compensation for Mag 2
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG2_ZCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Z Axis throttle compensation for Mag 2
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ID
parameter.short_desc: ID of Magnetometer the calibration is for

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ROT
parameter.short_desc: Rotation of magnetometer 3 relative to airframe
parameter.long_desc: An internal sensor will force a value of -1, so a GCS should only attempt to configure the rotation if the value is greater than or equal to zero.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_TEMP
parameter.long_desc: Temperature during last calibration.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_XCOMP
parameter.short_desc: X Axis throttle compensation for Mag 3
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between X component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_YCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Y Axis throttle compensation for Mag 3
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Y component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: CAL_MAG3_ZCOMP
parameter.short_desc: Z Axis throttle compensation for Mag 3
parameter.long_desc: Coefficient describing linear relationship between Z component of magnetometer in body frame axis and either current or throttle depending on value of CAL_MAG_COMP_TYP. Unit for throttle-based compensation is [G] and for current-based compensation [G/kA]

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_ANSC
parameter.long_desc: Pick the appropriate scaling from the datasheet. this number defines the (linear) conversion from voltage to Pascal (pa). For the MPXV7002DP this is 1000. NOTE: If the sensor always registers zero, try switching the static and dynamic tubes.

parameter.name: SENS_DPRES_OFF
parameter.long_desc: The offset (zero-reading) in Pascal

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXHGT
parameter.short_desc: Maximum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the maximum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The height setpoint will be limited to be no greater than this value when the navigation system is completely reliant on optical flow data and the height above ground estimate is valid. The sensor may be usable above this height, but accuracy will progressively degrade.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MAXR
parameter.short_desc: Magnitude of maximum angular flow rate reliably measurable by the optical flow sensor
parameter.long_desc: Optical flow data will not fused by the estimators if the magnitude of the flow rate exceeds this value and control loops will be instructed to limit ground speed such that the flow rate produced by movement over ground is less than 50% of this value.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_MINHGT
parameter.short_desc: Minimum height above ground when reliant on optical flow
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum distance from ground at which the optical flow sensor operates reliably. The sensor may be usable below this height, but accuracy will progressively reduce to loss of focus.

parameter.name: BAT1_C_MULT
parameter.short_desc: Capacity/current multiplier for high-current capable SMBUS battery

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_CMODEL
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed sensor compensation model for the SDP3x
parameter.long_desc: Model with Pitot CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Model without Pitot (1.5 mm tubes) CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Not used, 1.5 mm tubes assumed. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor. Tube Pressure Drop CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM: Diameter in mm of the pitot and tubes, must have the same diameter. CAL_AIR_TUBELEN: Length of the tubes connecting the pitot to the sensor and the static + dynamic port length of the pitot.

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_TUBED_MM
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed sensor tube diameter. Only used for the Tube Pressure Drop Compensation

parameter.name: CAL_AIR_TUBELEN
parameter.long_desc: See the CAL_AIR_CMODEL explanation on how this parameter should be set.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG_ROT_AUTO
parameter.long_desc: During calibration attempt to automatically determine the rotation of external magnetometers.

parameter.name: CAL_MAG_SIDES
parameter.short_desc: Bitfield selecting mag sides for calibration
parameter.long_desc: If set to two side calibration, only the offsets are estimated, the scale calibration is left unchanged. Thus an initial six side calibration is recommended. Bits: ORIENTATION_TAIL_DOWN = 1 ORIENTATION_NOSE_DOWN = 2 ORIENTATION_LEFT = 4 ORIENTATION_RIGHT = 8 ORIENTATION_UPSIDE_DOWN = 16 ORIENTATION_RIGHTSIDE_UP = 32

parameter.name: IMU_ACCEL_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for accel
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary accelerometer. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Cutoff frequency for angular acceleration (D-Term filter)
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter used on the time derivative of the measured angular velocity, also known as the D-term filter in the rate controller. The D-term uses the derivative of the rate and thus is the most susceptible to noise. Therefore, using a D-term filter allows to increase IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF, which leads to reduced control latency and permits to increase the P gains. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_CUTOFF
parameter.short_desc: Low pass filter cutoff frequency for gyro
parameter.long_desc: The cutoff frequency for the 2nd order butterworth filter on the primary gyro. This only affects the angular velocity sent to the controllers, not the estimators. It applies also to the angular acceleration (D-Term filter), see IMU_DGYRO_CUTOFF. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_BW
parameter.short_desc: IMU gyro ESC notch filter bandwidth
parameter.long_desc: Bandwidth per notch filter when using dynamic notch filtering with ESC RPM.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_DNF_EN
parameter.long_desc: Enable bank of dynamically updating notch filters. Requires ESC RPM feedback or onboard FFT (IMU_GYRO_FFT_EN).

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_NF_BW
parameter.long_desc: The frequency width of the stop band for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. See "IMU_GYRO_NF_FREQ" to activate the filter and to set the notch frequency. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_NF_FREQ
parameter.long_desc: The center frequency for the 2nd order notch filter on the primary gyro. This filter can be enabled to avoid feedback amplification of structural resonances at a specific frequency. This only affects the signal sent to the controllers, not the estimators. Applies to both angular velocity and angular acceleration sent to the controllers. See "IMU_GYRO_NF_BW" to set the bandwidth of the filter. A value of 0 disables the filter.

parameter.name: IMU_GYRO_RATEMAX
parameter.short_desc: Gyro control data maximum publication rate (inner loop rate)
parameter.long_desc: The maximum rate the gyro control data (vehicle_angular_velocity) will be allowed to publish at. This is the loop rate for the rate controller and outputs. Note: sensor data is always read and filtered at the full raw rate (eg commonly 8 kHz) regardless of this setting.

parameter.name: IMU_INTEG_RATE
parameter.long_desc: The rate at which raw IMU data is integrated to produce delta angles and delta velocities. Recommended to set this to a multiple of the estimator update period (currently 10 ms for ekf2).

parameter.name: PCF8583_MAGNET
parameter.long_desc: Nmumber of signals per rotation of actuator

parameter.name: PCF8583_POOL
parameter.long_desc: Determines how often the sensor is read out.

parameter.name: PCF8583_RESET
parameter.long_desc: Internal device counter is reset to 0 when overun this value, counter is able to store upto 6 digits reset of counter takes some time - measurement with reset has worse accurancy. 0 means reset counter after every measurement.

parameter.name: SENS_BARO_RATE
parameter.long_desc: Barometric air data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual barometric data rate is still dependant on the sensor.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the FMU board relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_X_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the X (Roll) axis It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Y_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Y (Pitch) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_BOARD_Z_OFF
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines a rotational offset in degrees around the Z (Yaw) axis. It allows the user to fine tune the board offset in the event of misalignment.

parameter.name: SENS_EN_BATT
parameter.short_desc: SMBUS Smart battery driver BQ40Z50 and BQ40Z80

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA226
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA226 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA228
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA228 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_INA238
parameter.long_desc: For systems a INA238 Power Monitor, this should be set to true

parameter.name: SENS_EN_MS4525
parameter.short_desc: TE MS4525 differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EN_MS5525
parameter.short_desc: TE MS5525 differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EN_SDP3X
parameter.short_desc: Sensirion SDP3X differential pressure sensor (external I2C)

parameter.name: SENS_EXT_I2C_PRB
parameter.long_desc: Probe for optional external I2C devices.

parameter.name: SENS_FLOW_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the PX4FLOW board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle. The recommneded installation default for the PX4FLOW board is with the Y axis forward (270 deg yaw).

parameter.name: SENS_GPS_MASK
parameter.long_desc: Set bits in the following positions to set which GPS accuracy metrics will be used to calculate the blending weight. Set to zero to disable and always used first GPS instance. 0 : Set to true to use speed accuracy 1 : Set to true to use horizontal position accuracy 2 : Set to true to use vertical position accuracy

parameter.name: SENS_GPS_PRIME
parameter.long_desc: When no blending is active, this defines the preferred GPS receiver instance. The GPS selection logic waits until the primary receiver is available to send data to the EKF even if a secondary instance is already available. The secondary instance is then only used if the primary one times out. To have an equal priority of all the instances, set this parameter to -1 and the best receiver will be used. This parameter has no effect if blending is active.

parameter.name: SENS_GPS_TAU
parameter.long_desc: Sets the longest time constant that will be applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to correct data from multiple GPS data for steady state position differences.

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_I
parameter.short_desc: IMU heater controller integrator gain value

parameter.name: SENS_IMU_TEMP_P
parameter.short_desc: IMU heater controller proportional gain value

parameter.name: SENS_INT_BARO_EN
parameter.long_desc: For systems with an external barometer, this should be set to false to make sure that the external is used.

parameter.name: SENS_MAG_AUTOCAL
parameter.long_desc: Automatically initialize magnetometer calibration from bias estimate if available.

parameter.name: SENS_MAG_RATE
parameter.long_desc: Magnetometer data maximum publication rate. This is an upper bound, actual magnetometer data rate is still dependant on the sensor.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_0_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_10_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_11_ROT

parameter.name: SENS_MB12_9_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT10_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT11_ROT

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT7_ROT

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT8_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_MPDT9_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the rotation of the Mappydot sensor relative to the platform.

parameter.name: SENS_OR_ADIS164X
parameter.short_desc: Analog Devices ADIS16448 IMU Orientation(external SPI)

parameter.name: SENS_TEMP_ID
parameter.short_desc: Target IMU device ID to regulate temperature

parameter.name: SIH_BARO_OFFSET
parameter.long_desc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable barometer

parameter.name: SIH_DISTSNSR_OVR
parameter.short_desc: if >= 0 the distance sensor measures will be overrided by this value
parameter.long_desc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable distance sensor

parameter.name: SIH_IXX
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_IXY
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IXZ
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IYY
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_IYZ
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. This value can be set to 0 for a quad symmetric about its center of mass.

parameter.name: SIH_IZZ
parameter.long_desc: The intertia is a 3 by 3 symmetric matrix. It represents the difficulty of the vehicle to modify its angular rate.

parameter.name: SIH_KDV
parameter.long_desc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules. The greater this value, the slower the quad will move. Drag force function of velocity: D=-KDV*V. The maximum freefall velocity can be computed as V=10*MASS/KDV [m/s]

parameter.name: SIH_KDW
parameter.long_desc: Physical coefficient representing the friction with air particules during rotations. The greater this value, the slower the quad will rotate. Aerodynamic moment function of body rate: Ma=-KDW*W_B. This value can be set to 0 if unknown.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_H0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the Above Mean Sea Level (AMSL) altitude where the simulation begins. If using FlightGear as a visual animation, this value can be tweaked such that the vehicle lies on the ground at takeoff. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_LAT0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the North-South location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_LON0
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the East-West location on Earth where the simulation begins. A value of 45 deg should be written 450000000. LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_MU_X
parameter.short_desc: North magnetic field at the initial location
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the North magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_MU_Y
parameter.short_desc: East magnetic field at the initial location
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the East magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_LOC_MU_Z
parameter.short_desc: Down magnetic field at the initial location
parameter.long_desc: This value represents the Down magnetic field at the initial location. A magnetic field calculator can be found on the NOAA website Note, the values need to be converted from nano Tesla to Gauss LAT0, LON0, H0, MU_X, MU_Y, and MU_Z should ideally be consistent among each others to represent a physical ground location on Earth.

parameter.name: SIH_L_PITCH
parameter.long_desc: This is the arm length generating the pitching moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the front and rear motors.

parameter.name: SIH_L_ROLL
parameter.long_desc: This is the arm length generating the rolling moment This value can be measured with a ruler. This corresponds to half the distance between the left and right motors.

parameter.name: SIH_MAG_OFFSET_X
parameter.long_desc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable magnetometer

parameter.name: SIH_MAG_OFFSET_Y
parameter.long_desc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable magnetometer

parameter.name: SIH_MAG_OFFSET_Z
parameter.long_desc: Absolute value superior to 10000 will disable magnetometer

parameter.name: SIH_MASS
parameter.long_desc: This value can be measured by weighting the quad on a scale.

parameter.name: SIH_Q_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum torque delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about few percent of the maximum thrust force.

parameter.name: SIH_T_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This is the maximum force delivered by one propeller when the motor is running at full speed. This value is usually about 5 times the mass of the quadrotor.

parameter.name: SIH_T_TAU
parameter.long_desc: the time taken for the thruster to step from 0 to 100% should be about 4 times tau

parameter.name: SIM_GPS_USED
parameter.short_desc: simulated GPS number of satellites used

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOCONFIG
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to reset parameters on next system startup (setting defaults). Platform-specific values are used if available. RC* parameters are preserved.

parameter.name: SYS_AUTOSTART
parameter.long_desc: CHANGING THIS VALUE REQUIRES A RESTART. Defines the auto-start script used to bootstrap the system.

parameter.name: SYS_BL_UPDATE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, update the bootloader on the next boot. WARNING: do not cut the power during an update process, otherwise you will have to recover using some alternative method (e.g. JTAG). Instructions: - Insert an SD card - Enable this parameter - Reboot the board (plug the power or send a reboot command) - Wait until the board comes back up (or at least 2 minutes) - If it does not come back, check the file bootlog.txt on the SD card

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_ACCEL
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of accelerometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of barometer thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_GYRO
parameter.short_desc: Enable auto start of rate gyro thermal calibration at the next power up
parameter.long_desc: 0 : Set to 0 to do nothing 1 : Set to 1 to start a calibration at next boot This parameter is reset to zero when the temperature calibration starts. default (0, no calibration)

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TDEL
parameter.short_desc: Required temperature rise during thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: A temperature increase greater than this value is required during calibration. Calibration will complete for each sensor when the temperature increase above the starting temeprature exceeds the value set by SYS_CAL_TDEL. If the temperature rise is insufficient, the calibration will continue indefinitely and the board will need to be repowered to exit.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMAX
parameter.short_desc: Maximum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration will not start if the temperature of any sensor is higher than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMAX.

parameter.name: SYS_CAL_TMIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum starting temperature for thermal calibration
parameter.long_desc: Temperature calibration for each sensor will ignore data if the temperature is lower than the value set by SYS_CAL_TMIN.

parameter.name: SYS_CTRL_ALLOC
parameter.long_desc: If disabled, the existing mixing implementation is used. If enabled, dynamic control allocation with runtime configuration of the mixing and output functions is used. Note: this is work-in-progress and not all vehicle types are supported yet.

parameter.name: SYS_FAC_CAL_MODE
parameter.long_desc: If enabled, future sensor calibrations will be stored to /fs/mtd_caldata. Note: this is only supported on boards with a separate calibration storage /fs/mtd_caldata.

parameter.name: SYS_FAILURE_EN
parameter.long_desc: If enabled allows MAVLink INJECT_FAILURE commands. WARNING: the failures can easily cause crashes and are to be used with caution!

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_BARO
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a barometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no barometer, such as some of the Omnibus F4 SD variants. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a barometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_GPS
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a GPS
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the system has no GPS. If disabled, the sensors hub will not process sensor_gps, and GPS will not be available for the rest of the system.

parameter.name: SYS_HAS_MAG
parameter.short_desc: Control if the vehicle has a magnetometer
parameter.long_desc: Disable this if the board has no magnetometer, such as the Omnibus F4 SD. If disabled, the preflight checks will not check for the presence of a magnetometer.

parameter.name: SYS_HITL
parameter.short_desc: Enable HITL/SIH mode on next boot
parameter.long_desc: While enabled the system will boot in Hardware-In-The-Loop (HITL) or Simulation-In-Hardware (SIH) mode and not enable all sensors and checks. When disabled the same vehicle can be flown normally. Set to 'external HITL', if the system should perform as if it were a real vehicle (the only difference to a real system is then only the parameter value, which can be used for log analysis).

parameter.name: SYS_MC_EST_GROUP
parameter.long_desc: Set the group of estimators used for multicopters and VTOLs

parameter.name: SYS_RGB_MAXBRT
parameter.long_desc: Set to 0 to disable, 1 for maximum brightness

parameter.name: SYS_USE_IO
parameter.long_desc: Can be used to use a configure the use of the IO board.

parameter.name: TEL_BST_EN
parameter.long_desc: If true, the FMU will try to connect to Blacksheep telemetry on start up

parameter.name: TC_G_ENABLE
parameter.short_desc: Thermal compensation for rate gyro sensors

parameter.name: CANNODE_FLOW_ROT
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the yaw rotation of the Cannode flow board relative to the vehicle body frame. Zero rotation is defined as X on flow board pointing towards front of vehicle.

parameter.name: CANNODE_NODE_ID
parameter.long_desc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: 0 - UAVCAN disabled. 1 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors without dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. 2 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors with dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. 3 - Enables support for UAVCAN sensors and actuators with dynamic node ID allocation and firmware update. Also sets the motor control outputs to UAVCAN.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_ESC_IDLT
parameter.short_desc: UAVCAN ESC will spin at idle throttle when armed, even if the mixer outputs zero setpoints

parameter.name: UAVCAN_LGT_ANTCL
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the ANTI_COLLISION lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on

parameter.name: UAVCAN_LGT_LAND
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the LIGHT_ID_LANDING lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on

parameter.name: UAVCAN_LGT_NAV
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the RIGHT_OF_WAY lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on

parameter.name: UAVCAN_LGT_STROB
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum condition under which the system will command the STROBE lights on 0 - Always off 1 - When autopilot is armed 2 - When autopilot is prearmed 3 - Always on

parameter.name: UAVCAN_NODE_ID
parameter.long_desc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_RNG_MAX
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the maximum valid range for a rangefinder connected via UAVCAN.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_RNG_MIN
parameter.long_desc: This parameter defines the minimum valid range for a rangefinder connected via UAVCAN.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_ASPD
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN airspeed subscriptions. uavcan::equipment::air_data::IndicatedAirspeed uavcan::equipment::air_data::TrueAirspeed uavcan::equipment::air_data::StaticTemperature

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_BARO
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN barometer subscription. uavcan::equipment::air_data::StaticPressure uavcan::equipment::air_data::StaticTemperature

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_BAT
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN battery subscription. 1) uavcan::equipment::power::BatteryInfo 2) cuav::equipment::power::CBAT

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_DPRES
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN differential pressure subscription. uavcan::equipment::air_data::RawAirData

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_FLOW
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN optical flow subscription.

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_GPS
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN GPS subscriptions. uavcan::equipment::gnss::Fix uavcan::equipment::gnss::Fix2 uavcan::equipment::gnss::Auxiliary

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_ICE
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN internal combusion engine (ICE) subscription. uavcan::equipment::ice::reciprocating::Status

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_IMU
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN IMU subscription. uavcan::equipment::ahrs::RawIMU

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_MAG
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN GPS subscription. uavcan::equipment::ahrs::MagneticFieldStrength uavcan::equipment::ahrs::MagneticFieldStrength2

parameter.name: UAVCAN_SUB_RNG
parameter.long_desc: Enable UAVCAN GPS subscription. uavcan::equipment::range_sensor::Measurement

parameter.name: UAVCAN_V1_ENABLE
parameter.long_desc: 0 - UAVCAN disabled. 1 - Enables UAVCANv1

parameter.name: UCAN1_ACTR_PUB
parameter.short_desc: actuator_outputs uORB over UAVCAN v1 publication port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_BMS_BP_SUB
parameter.short_desc: DS-015 battery parameters subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_BMS_BS_SUB
parameter.short_desc: DS-015 battery status subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_BMS_ES_SUB
parameter.short_desc: DS-015 battery energy source subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_ESC_PUB
parameter.short_desc: UAVCAN v1 ESC publication port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_GPS_PUB
parameter.short_desc: UAVCAN v1 GPS publication port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_LG_BMS_SUB
parameter.short_desc: UAVCAN v1 leagcy battery port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_SERVO_PUB
parameter.short_desc: UAVCAN v1 Servo publication port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_UORB_GPS
parameter.short_desc: sensor_gps uORB over UAVCAN v1 subscription port ID

parameter.name: UCAN1_UORB_GPS_P
parameter.short_desc: sensor_gps uORB over UAVCAN v1 publication port ID

parameter.name: UAVCAN_V1_ID
parameter.long_desc: Read the specs at http://uavcan.org to learn more about Node ID.

parameter.name: VT_ARSP_BLEND
parameter.long_desc: Airspeed at which we can start blending both fw and mc controls. Set to 0 to disable.

parameter.name: VT_ARSP_TRANS
parameter.long_desc: Airspeed at which we can switch to fw mode

parameter.name: VT_B_DEC_FF
parameter.short_desc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch feedforward gain

parameter.name: VT_B_DEC_I
parameter.short_desc: Backtransition deceleration setpoint to pitch I gain

parameter.name: VT_B_DEC_MSS
parameter.long_desc: The approximate deceleration during a back transition in m/s/s Used to calculate back transition distance in mission mode. A lower value will make the VTOL transition further from the destination waypoint. For standard vtol and tiltrotors a controller is used to track this value during the transition.

parameter.name: VT_B_REV_DEL
parameter.short_desc: Delay in seconds before applying back transition throttle
parameter.long_desc: Set this to a value greater than 0 to give the motor time to spin down. unit s

parameter.name: VT_B_REV_OUT
parameter.short_desc: Output on airbrakes channel during back transition
parameter.long_desc: Used for airbrakes or with ESCs that have reverse thrust enabled on a seperate channel Airbrakes need to be enables for your selected model/mixer

parameter.name: VT_B_TRANS_DUR
parameter.long_desc: Time in seconds used for a back transition

parameter.name: VT_B_TRANS_RAMP
parameter.short_desc: Back transition MC motor ramp up time
parameter.long_desc: This sets the duration during which the MC motors ramp up to the commanded thrust during the back transition stage.

parameter.name: VT_B_TRANS_THR
parameter.short_desc: Target throttle value for the transition to hover flight
parameter.long_desc: standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle Note for standard vtol: For ESCs and mixers that support reverse thrust on low PWM values set this to a negative value to apply active breaking For ESCs that support thrust reversal with a control channel please set VT_B_REV_OUT and set this to a positive value to apply active breaking

parameter.name: VT_ELEV_MC_LOCK
parameter.long_desc: If set to 1 the elevons are locked in multicopter mode

parameter.name: VT_FWD_THRUST_EN
parameter.short_desc: Enable/disable usage of fixed-wing actuators in hover to generate forward force (instead of pitching down)
parameter.long_desc: This technique can be used to avoid the plane having to pitch down in order to move forward. This prevents large, negative lift values being created when facing strong winds. Fixed-wing forward actuators refers to puller/pusher (standard VTOL), or forward-tilt (tiltrotor VTOL). Only active if demaded down pitch is below VT_PITCH_MIN, and uses VT_FWD_THRUST_SC to get from demanded down pitch to fixed-wing actuation.

values.value: Disable FW forward actuation in hover.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes (except LANDING).
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes.
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT1 (except LANDING).
Enable FW forward actuation in hover in altitude, position and auto modes if above MPC_LAND_ALT2 (except LANDING).

parameter.name: VT_FWD_THRUST_SC
parameter.short_desc: Fixed-wing actuator thrust scale for hover forward flight
parameter.long_desc: Scale applied to the demanded down-pitch to get the fixed-wing forward actuation in hover mode. Only active if demaded down pitch is below VT_PITCH_MIN. Enabled via VT_FWD_THRUST_EN.

parameter.name: VT_FW_ALT_ERR
parameter.long_desc: Maximum negative altitude error for fixed wing flight. If the altitude drops below this value below the altitude setpoint the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL.

parameter.name: VT_FW_DIFTHR_EN
parameter.long_desc: Set to 1 to enable differential thrust in fixed-wing flight.

parameter.name: VT_FW_DIFTHR_SC
parameter.long_desc: This factor specifies how the yaw input gets mapped to differential thrust in forwards flight.

parameter.name: VT_FW_MIN_ALT
parameter.long_desc: Minimum altitude for fixed wing flight, when in fixed wing the altitude drops below this altitude the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameter.name: VT_FW_MOT_OFFID
parameter.short_desc: The channel number of motors that must be turned off in fixed wing mode

parameter.name: VT_FW_PERM_STAB
parameter.long_desc: If set to one this parameter will cause permanent attitude stabilization in fw mode. This parameter has been introduced for pure convenience sake.

parameter.name: VT_FW_QC_P
parameter.long_desc: Maximum pitch angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameter.name: VT_FW_QC_R
parameter.long_desc: Maximum roll angle before QuadChute engages Above this the vehicle will transition back to MC mode and enter failsafe RTL

parameter.name: VT_F_TRANS_DUR
parameter.long_desc: Time in seconds used for a transition

parameter.name: VT_F_TRANS_THR
parameter.short_desc: Target throttle value for the transition to fixed wing flight
parameter.long_desc: standard vtol: pusher tailsitter, tiltrotor: main throttle

parameter.name: VT_F_TR_OL_TM
parameter.short_desc: Airspeed less front transition time (open loop)
parameter.long_desc: The duration of the front transition when there is no airspeed feedback available.

parameter.name: VT_IDLE_PWM_MC
parameter.short_desc: Idle speed of VTOL when in multicopter mode

parameter.name: VT_LND_PTCH_MIN
parameter.short_desc: Minimum pitch angle during hover landing
parameter.long_desc: Overrides VT_PTCH_MIN when the vehicle is in LAND mode (hovering). During landing it can be beneficial to allow lower minimum pitch angles as it can avoid the wings generating too much lift and preventing the vehicle from sinking at the desired rate.

parameter.name: VT_MC_ON_FMU
parameter.short_desc: Enable the usage of AUX outputs for hover motors
parameter.long_desc: Set this parameter to true if the vehicle's hover motors are connected to the FMU (AUX) port. Not required for boards that only have a FMU, and no IO. Only applies for standard VTOL and tiltrotor.

parameter.name: VT_MOT_ID
parameter.short_desc: The channel number of motors which provide lift during hover

parameter.name: VT_PSHER_RMP_DT
parameter.long_desc: Defines the time window during which the pusher throttle will be ramped up linearly to VT_F_TRANS_THR during a transition to fixed wing mode. Zero or negative values will produce an instant throttle rise to VT_F_TRANS_THR.

parameter.name: VT_PTCH_MIN
parameter.long_desc: Minimum pitch angle during hover flight. If the desired pitch angle is is lower than this value then the fixed-wing forward actuation can be used to compensate for the missing thrust in forward direction (see VT_FW_TRHUST_EN)

parameter.name: VT_TILT_FW
parameter.short_desc: Position of tilt servo in fw mode

parameter.name: VT_TILT_MC
parameter.short_desc: Position of tilt servo in mc mode

parameter.name: VT_TILT_SPINUP
parameter.short_desc: Tilt actuator control value commanded when disarmed and during the first second after arming
parameter.long_desc: This specific tilt during spin-up is necessary for some systems whose motors otherwise don't spin-up freely.

parameter.name: VT_TILT_TRANS
parameter.short_desc: Position of tilt servo in transition mode

parameter.name: VT_TRANS_MIN_TM
parameter.long_desc: Minimum time in seconds for front transition.

parameter.name: VT_TRANS_P2_DUR
parameter.long_desc: Time in seconds it should take for the rotors to rotate forward completely from the point when the plane has picked up enough airspeed and is ready to go into fixed wind mode.

parameter.name: VT_TRANS_TIMEOUT
parameter.long_desc: Time in seconds after which transition will be cancelled. Disabled if set to 0.

parameter.name: WV_GAIN
parameter.long_desc: The desired gain to convert roll sp into yaw rate sp.

parameter.name: MPC_LAND_RC_HELP
parameter.short_desc: Enable user assisted descent speed for autonomous land routine
parameter.long_desc: When enabled, descent speed will be: stick full up - 0 stick centered - MPC_LAND_SPEED stick full down - 2 * MPC_LAND_SPEED

values.value: skip the controller and feedthrough the setpoints
